intro: Rapistrum cakile, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in saline or sandy soils and is often found along shorelines and in maritime environments. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is also known for its edible leaves and has been used in traditional cuisines.
